snippet: The City Council in Tripoli, where the deputy intelligence chief was seized, called a general strike to demand that militias leave the city.
abstract: Libyan officials say Mustafa Noah, deputy chief of the country's intelligence service, was temporarily abducted as a standoff between militias and a general strike against militia rule virtually shut down the city of Tripoli; Noah was released unharmed.
lead_paragraph: The City Council in Tripoli, where the deputy intelligence chief was seized, called a general strike to demand that militias leave the city.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
